question: A 10 kg box is pushed with a force of 50 N. If friction force is 20 N, what is the acceleration?
solution: Net force = Applied force - Friction = 50 - 20 = 30 N. Using F = ma, acceleration = F/m = 30/10 = 3 m/s²

question: What is the coefficient of static friction if a 5 kg object starts sliding when pulled with 25 N force?
solution: At the point of sliding, Applied force = Maximum static friction. fs,max = μsN = μsmg. Therefore μs = F/(mg) = 25/(5×9.8) = 0.51 ≈ 0.5
